title: You'd Best Not Finish
warnings: Choose Not To Use Archive Warnings, No Archive Warnings Apply
post_title: A slightly hornier rewrite of the last scene in Ultimate Spider-Man#6. That's it. That's the fic.
comment:
Peter stood there, his hands in his pockets, waiting for Mary Jane to say something.
Her hair had been tied back for the duration of breakfast, but now, with MJ fiercely undoing her head band, it was coming loose.
There she stood, her long scarlet locks flowing down,
“What do you expect from me Peter?” she asked. Tapping her foot on the floor.
“Anger of the righteous variety. 100 percent” Peter replied.
“It’s not so much that, it’s just...I’m five percent disappointed”
Peter raised an eyebrow, most curious.
“Disappointed always hurts” he admitted.
“I mean, you could have come back with more than cuts and bruises” she continued.
“Or not come back at all, you don’t need to bring it up” Peter said, trying to assert control of his own reprimanding, to take ownership of what he had done.
“You just did” MJ replied, her arms folded, she stared upward at the ceiling, then directed her looks to Peter, her expression shifted from a stern disciplinarian to lustful and loving.
“That’s where the five percent comes from Tiger, five percent I can handle, and five percent I can mend”
MJ skilfully undid her belt buckle, and slid out of her jeans.
She walked over to Peter and wrapped her arms around him, gently pressing her lips to his nose and giving it a gentle peck. Her right hand brushed delicately against his bruised features.
“Show me the suit” she said.
Peter obliged, and conjured forth his outfit.
“How does it look on me?” he asked.
“It’s... enterprising. You certainly ‘arrive’ with it, and when you leave, nobody will forget you were there, or what you did for them”
“Mayday picked out the design” Peter said.
“Bold girl” MJ continued, already thinking of a place and time to spend with her daughter as a reward for lending her insight and creativity to her dad’s cause.
“This whole task ahead of me is bold MJ...I don’t know what it is, but I feel there’s untold millions of me out there, millions of worlds, where I give just a hundred percent, when I should be  giving it a thousand. I know I haven’t left second or third gear yet, but when I shift gears, it has to be full on Turbo. I can’t get across the track without someone waiting at the finish line. Be that for me MJ, help me race ahead”
MJ pricked his nose with a gentle tap of her fingertip before wrapping both arms around her shirt and tugged it over her head. She quickly unhooked her bra and stood before Peter wearing nothing but a black thong.
“You’re going to take me out there, into the city, into the wild, I’m going to feel the barren sky on my naked back, I’m going to take in the sights, the sounds, the scents, the sensations of the day, and then you are going to carry me home...and after that, we’re going for a run of a different sort...and, tiger, for my sake, you’d
best not finish
”
writing_prompt: Peter wrestles with the weight of his responsibilities as Spider-Man, but when Mary Jane challenges him to push beyond his limits, their bond becomes the anchor he needs to face the multitudes of himself—and the unknown challenges ahead.

title: The Amber of Yesteryear
warnings: Choose Not To Use Archive Warnings, No Archive Warnings Apply
post_title: Jubilee confronts a jerk, and soon everyone takes notice
comment:
Jubilee stood in familiar settings, spent in days she had cherished many years’ younger, dangerous situations, ones that challenged her mortality, but it was when she felt most alive.
That was when she knew she could rely on her friends, her mentors, and her family. Uncomplicated, sure of themselves, ready for anything.
These were the days and years where she felt most welcome.
Now, with Roberto, a boy, a friend, and a bit of both combined, critically injured a few meters away from her, she realized she was no longer here to play, not when there was a price to pay.
She stood before her enemy; her thoughts cast themselves back to the first few words she had uttered to Roberto when he had dropped in on her earlier in the day, after her birthday plans had been denied to her.
“Magneto is a jerk”
And how appropriate now, that the foe she was staring down, draped in his all too familiar crimson red and purple armour, helmet attached, a formidable and seemingly impenetrable energy bubble surrounding him, was the physical embodiment of that who had jerked her around.
This wasn’t a game, but it felt as though this was still playtime.
Could she still have fun even if it were all business?
“I am Magneto, master of magnet” decreed the simulation.
“Come again?” asked Jubilee.
‘Magneto’ approached her, raising his arms, stacks of metal boxes raised them high and were thrust towards Jubilee’s person, she darted left and right as they came crashing down, breaking open upon impact and revealing smaller components of metallic apparatus that, in turn, also became projectiles to throw at the hapless X-Man.
“X-Men, welcome to die”
“You’re missing out on an ‘you’re there’ Mags, not only are you a jerk even in this game, you’re one major illiterate” Jubilee remarked.
Observing the action from his auditorium, Mojo turned to his comms and rattled censored obscenities in the ears of Spiral seated at the controls.
“I thought you sorted out those glitches during the last few beta runs” Mojo yelled.
“Someone within the system must have saved a few and are grafting them onto the existing patch” Spiral said in an attempt to explain, something Mojo picked up on.
“Listen to yourself; you’re somehow trying to convince me that this was somehow somebody else’s fault?”
Spiral muttered a few choice phrases of her own as Mojo berated her.
Mojo sulked, but only for a moment, he would not let the crushing reality of bad patching get in the way of his grand presentation.
“Just fix it, that little jubilant punk’s bound to start playing the game any minute now, and when she comes to rise, oh what a fall she’ll have when we trip her up. This game has to be perfect...we must preserve her every memory, her ideal vision of her world....were we to ever veer away from it, then just what would the point of nostalgia be? People want escapism, an opportunity to relive the past, let’s not drag our memories into the dreg of tomorrow, this is the amber of yesteryear, and you are all welcome to die in it!”
writing_prompt: Trapped in a twisted simulation designed to exploit her nostalgia, Jubilee must outwit a glitchy, overdramatic Magneto and uncover the sinister purpose behind Mojo's "perfect" game before the past becomes her prison.

title: The Grace of the Sun
warnings: Choose Not To Use Archive Warnings, No Archive Warnings Apply
post_title: It is not up to us to control who we love, all we are required to do is understand it
comment:
“Family is a choice”
Jean’s smile was all that was needed to assure Kurt that his words were wise, and that they had value.
In times like these, where all of his kind required, above all else, understanding and tolerance, it was important to put faith first in their hearts, and to let those they entrust with their love guide them to the next phase in their journey.
Together as a family. Together as a race.
But Jean caught herself thinking a great deal about Kurt’s connection to Rogue, and how grief had brought them together in a masterful way. She recognised something in Rogue’s instincts on that fateful day, something that centred her.
Something she had been missing since losing Remy.
“Kurt....I saw what you did for Rogue in Mexico, she relied on your strength all so readily, yet you haven’t been in touch all that long, I didn’t mean to pry, but...that felt more like she was yearning, not reaching. Whatever it was she was looking for, I could empathically tell it wasn’t solace”
“The brightest eyes see things clearer than the path of day within the grace of the sun. Even when the weather isn’t as fair, there is no rain”
Kurt gazed upon Rogue’s comatose body, he gently stroked her warm southern hair, and delicately ran his finger down the side of her cheek as a small tear escaped its duct and gingerly ran down her face, a sign she was attempting to stir herself back to consciousness.
“No rain at all”
“Is it more comforting to lie?” Jean asked.
“Does Rogue hurt?” Kurt asked, sidestepping the question asked to him.
“I can hear her thoughts, they are centred on Remy, Erick...Cody.....and...you. You’re in the most esteemed company” Jean remarked.
“But does she hurt?” Kurt insisted.
“No...no, these thoughts are of healing” Jean explained, “It goes back to what you said, she helped them live, before and after they gave a piece of themselves to her, she’s relying on their love for her, their strengths, even their weaknesses bring her humility, humbling, allowing her mind a state of grace”
“Even with all the faith I have for her, all the understanding for her love, I fear this form of healing is one for the mind, not the heart. She is sharply tooling herself. Experiences of squandered potential with Remy, guilt with Cody, shame with Carol...all combustible elements, she is sharply tooling herself into a weapon. She will soon be blessed with purpose. Built...for war”
“Not a cloud in the sky and it’s as if we know the storm is coming. I’m sorry Kurt, I’d try my best to help but if I were to give her a nudge in the opposite direction, I don’t know if I could understand the choice I made tomorrow” a saddened Jean replied.
“It is not up to us to control who we love, all we are required to do is understand it” Kurt said, draping the bed sheets neatly over Rogue’s shoulders, blowing her a kiss.
“What do you understand about this?” Jean asked.
“That even within the grace of the sun, there is always fire”
writing_prompt: As Rogue lies comatose, her mind a battlefield of love, loss, and purpose, Kurt and Jean wrestle with the question: can understanding and faith alone guide someone destined to become a weapon of war?

title: Front & Back
warnings: Choose Not To Use Archive Warnings, No Archive Warnings Apply
post_title: What if the Toymaker didn't neglect the fam in his puppet show?
comment:
The Toymaker, realizing The Doctor had a contrary answer to everything he could throw at him in regards to guilt, pressed ahead with his puppet show, and pivoted away from the point he was making.
“Then, he was meeting Graham, Yasmin, and Ryan. Graham was scared that the cancer, it would be returning, so he confided his fears in the good Doctor, hoping she would reassure him, but she said nothing, and he had to head into the unknown with her full of uncertainty, not knowing if he would continue to live or die in front of his friends”
“Doctor? Do you have an answer to that?” Donna asked the man seated beside her.
The Fourteenth Doctor gritted his teeth, his mind raced, scrambling to come up with something to say in regards to that.
In his Thirteenth incarnation, he had kept a great deal bottled up, all of them secrets , and feelings. Like so many incarnations before her, the Thirteenth feared more than anything else an ending of some sort, she always tried to avoid the tragedies.
But seeing the Toymaker remind him of Amy, Clara, and Bill, made The Doctor realize that there’d been a phase where he had been slipping, he’d gotten too big, too noisy, and in trying to downplay that, he’d gotten far too complacent and careless.
Yaz was up next, seated opposite Graham.
“And then, the Doctor found love once again, this time with Yasmin Khan, who was being with her for the rest of her days, yes, but then, those days came to an end, and the Thirteenth, she was killed by The Master and in her last moments of life, chose to spend it in full view of a sunrise, und she was all alone. She left Yasmin in a park, und and never said goodbye.  Yaz’s heart was left utterly broken”
The scissors cut through Yaz and Graham’s strings and they collapsed to the floor of the puppet theatre.
Despite the nagging doubts in his mind, The Doctor steeled himself and gave his response.
“Graham would dedicate himself to keeping the planet safe whenever I was not there to defend it, and both he and Yaz would find solace with an abundance of allies, each with   trauma and tragedy to the front and back of them, at no point did any of their experiences break them, they are there for each other, tried and true companions all”
Oh well that’s alright then!
“What about Ryan?” Donna whispered
“Oh Ryan? He was the grown up in the fam, he knew when to cut out early, more to the point he convinced Graham to come with him”
“Well...that’s more than alright in my book, that, space man, is an achievement. Any man who can talk someone out of the adventure of a lifetime is someone worth listening to.”
“What do you mean by that?” The Doctor said.
“We’ll talk about it later. When you’re ready, you’ll listen”
“Listen to this Donna Noble, and listen clear, I will get you out of this, I love you”
“Love you too, you great thin pastry”
As the two leaned in for a kiss, The Toymaker continued his macabre show.
“And then, there came the Flux...”
writing_prompt: Trapped in the Toymaker's twisted puppet theater, the Doctor must confront the ghosts of past companions and the weight of choices made across lifetimes—while Donna Noble watches, waiting for the moment to remind him of who he truly is.

title: The Plan
warnings: Choose Not To Use Archive Warnings, No Archive Warnings Apply
post_title: Peter and MJ change inside of a very narrow alleyway, both might not make it to dinner, but they have ultimately made it back to one another (fix it for ASM#60)
comment:
“We’re late, we’re late” repeated Spider-Man as he and Jackpot leapt over rooftops and cut through the crisp chill of October evening eon route to a restaurant, and a rendezvous with two people that neither of the two imagined would be happy to be held up.
“This ain’t Wonderland Tiger” Jackpot replied as the two touched down beside a tall dumpster in a nearby alleyway.
Spider-Man yanked off his mask to reveal the features of Peter Parker, as Jackpot removed her shades to reveal the kindly and exotically charmed face of one Mary Jane Watson.
The two scrambled for a pair of duffle bags stored inside of the dumpster, with just as much speed, they quickly unzipped the bags to reveal their contents...civilian clothing for the pair of them.
“Why did Anna and I agree to this? They’re gonna figure it out” Peter said aloud as he and Mary Jane hastily slipped out of their costumes.
“Stick to the plan Tiger, it’s all something we can look back on and laugh about when they’re thanking us for their babies” Mary Jane replied.
“Why doesn’t Paul know already? He’s your guy in the chair” Peter argued.
“He’s not chronically online Peter, besides none of this would have worked out if he were. We had a narrow escape when we changed back at Ravencroft. He had to go and make the Korma, missed the whole show”
“This is a really narrow alleyway, hardly one at all, you sure nobody’s taking a glance in our direction?”
“Your Spider-Sense would alert you wouldn’t it?” Mary Jane asked.
“Maybe it already is, maybe I want us to be caught” Peter said smugly, giving MJ a demented grin, MJ nudged his shoulder and pushed his face away from hers.
“We still pressed for time?” MJ asked.
“Shay sent me six texts” Peter replied.
“Guess we’re not that lucky” MJ remarked.
“Get a move on Tigres” said Peter.
The two stashed what was left of their costumes into the bags and dashed through the streets, crossing even before the traffic turned green. They made their way over to the restaurant and stopped just short of the entrance.
They glanced through the window to find Paul and Shay at their seats, making small talk between one another while studying their menus.
“Looks like they’re two steps ahead of us Pete” said MJ.
“Yeah, do they really need us to be there after all?” Peter asked.
MJ reached out and squeezed his hand. Peter tensed up.
“We sure you want to try again?”
“I’m unshackled Pete, have been since the kids...vanished, what I had with Paul was always Rabin’s magic, it took a while to fade, but...well, that’s what life’s about isn’t it? It all just fades away, and all that’s left is regret, and shame, the longing...strip it all away and...”
“...All that’s left is us” said Peter.
Mary Jane leaned over and kissed Peter on the lips.
“I thought we were still on a cheek-to-cheek basis?”
“Battlefield promotion Tiger” said MJ.
Peter wrapped his arm around MJs’
“We’d best not keep them waiting” Peter said
“Stick to the plan Pete...we’re to get them acquainted, then let ‘em down easy where we’re concerned, it’s going to take time, it won’t be easy to strip this all away....but this is about responsibility.”
“What makes this easier Red, is that by the end of us, all that’s left of it is us” Peter assured her
Arm in arm, they walked inside.
writing_prompt: Peter Parker and Mary Jane Watson are on a mission—not to save the city, but to navigate a dinner with their significant others while hiding the truth about their rekindled connection. What could possibly go wrong?

title: Today Is Tomorrow
warnings: Choose Not To Use Archive Warnings, No Archive Warnings Apply
post_title: A short canon divergence during the official episode "Bad Bear Day"...Hailey, transfixed by her own hopeless romanticism, dreams of a perfect opportunity, and comes to realize some things can't wait 'till tomorrow...
comment:
“Hailey, do you remember when I used this?” Scott asked as he held the bottle of honeydew in close proximity to his face.
Hailey just stood there, mesmerised.
“Do I remember those five and a half days where your hair bounced with every step and you looked like a magazine cover come to life?”
Scott paused, and looked at how lost in her own world his best friend was, unflinching, staring into a cosy, tranquil abyss.
“Wow...that’s...that’s something” he said.
“It sure is”
Scott’s scratched the back of his neck anxiously.
“You know, you could do with some of this gel yourself...” Scott revealed, which was enough to snap Hailey out of her spot.
“Remember what Weird Al said, bears are no joke, and I do not want to get that up close and personal with a call from the wild” Hailey cautioned.
“You sound like you’d rather get real close to something else...no really Hailey, I’d keep you safe”
Hailey folded her arms, pretending to be unimpressed.
“My knight in shining hair gel” she replied, raising an eyebrow.
Scott nudged her, she nudged him back.
“Should I put some on then?” Scott asked.
“If you want to keep my feet firmly rooted to the spot, go right ahead” Hailey teased.
“Hailey, are you sure this is the best time?” Beta whispered.
“For what?” Hailey asked.
“He means the kiss” Scott finished for him, which took Beta and Hailey by surprise.
“You...you KNOW about that?” Hailey realized, clasping her mouth with her hand, unable to contain the sense of euphoria and wild hormone-driven excitement.
“It’s why I asked if you wouldn’t mind putting some of this on for me, so you’d look your best”
“Scott, I don’t want to kiss you if there’s a bear loose, he could interrupt us...and do so much worse to you and me”
“Not cosy with the notion then?”
“Please, Scott, of course I want to kiss you, I almost did back during that dare remember...it’s just, I didn’t think it was the right time, I wanted the moment to be special, no pressure, no real plan, only if ...it felt right”
“Tomorrow then?” Scott asked.
“What’s so special about tomorrow?” Hailey asked.
“Nothing...’till we kiss” teased Scott.
“Scott...I...this is...it’s so sudden,  I can't begin to describe what I’m feeling...”
“I think you’ll do just fine with a magazine cover for now” Scott said, and put on the hair gel. He slicked his hair back, and in doing so, Hailey’s world went into slow motion meltdown.
Meanwhile, back in the real world, for all of this was playing out in Hailey's head, Scott was frantically snapping his fingers directly in front of his best friend, and getting no response. He took her glasses off and continued the action.
“Has she moved yet?”  Beta asked.
“Not even a blink...she’s totally shut down. Beta...be honest with me...has she been a robot this whole time?”
“Oh for crying out loud...” Beta remarked, and kicked Hailey at the back of her heel to snap her out of her hypnotic glare.
With a spring in her step, Hailey threw herself into Scott’s arms and sweetly whispered something important in his ear.
"It happens today"
"What happens?" Scott asked
Hailey's answer was but one word, and the promise of an eternal memory.
Just one word.
No plan.
No pressure.
It just felt right.
“Tomorrow”
Stroking his face tenderly, she sealed her promise with the kiss of a lifetime.
writing_prompt: Caught in a moment of playful banter, Hailey and Scott realize their feelings for each other, but with a bear possibly lurking nearby, timing their first kiss becomes a matter of both romance and survival.

title: The Word Of Sutekh
warnings: Choose Not To Use Archive Warnings, No Archive Warnings Apply
post_title: Left alone in the TARDIS, The Doctor prepares for adventure, but how long has it been since the TARDIS has truly called an adventure her own? And why has he cried more than he ever has in the past?  (spoilers for "Empire of Death")
comment:
Ruby Sunday, her story now on a different trajectory than that of her dear friend,  turned and made her graceful exit from the TARDIS, The Doctor stood with his back turned, staring at the console, his fingers etching ever closer to the master switch.
One flick and it would be all waiting for him. All of time, space, and adventure. His infinite calling.
And as he took a moment to pause, the tears came flooding down once again.
Surely they should have stopped by now. Evil had been averted. Chaos prevented, an empire had been reduced to ash and ruin, he had brought death to its own door, and life had prevailed.
The tears had plagued him for as long as he had been encountering the many splinters of Susan Triad, or felt the cold and sensitive touch of a snowflake brought about by a lively Ruby. Just why had he been in a highly emotional state?
He allowed himself the pause to reflect on what he believed to be the case, and what he believed in could not be entertained further, not if he wished to continue traversing creation and righting wrongs wherever he was needed.
But that was just it, everything he had been told to believe in all of his lives had proven to be misdirects and manipulations, and now the one thing he wasn’t certain about was the intent of his ship.
It also tied back to what he had told Ruby when they first travelled together, that he had no job, no responsibility, that he had freedom, and yet, he had come to find the TARDIS had none, that it was at the beck and call, the manipulations and machinations, of another greater, stronger force that had bent it to its almighty will.
His mind drifted back to the days of the Eleventh, the encounter with the dark entity known as House, a predator of Time Lords, and his strange family, one of whom became the host body for what he believed to be the very essence of the TARDIS itself.
It had told him that she never took him to where he wanted to be, but where he was needed.
My god
, thought The Doctor,
Was that a warning? Or a lie? A trick? Or perhaps a means of conveying what was required of me along? To serve as a means by which to assert dominance and death across the fabric of the universe?
What does he believe now?
The choice brought him to tears.
For the sake of preserving sanity in the universe, to bring comfort to civilisations, and joy to the world, he could not afford to invite any signs of doubt to intrude upon him, for doubt would bring disaster, and too many had seen that from him, and too many hearts had been broken trying to shield them from it too.
Just ask Susan.
The Doctor fought back the tears, he wondered if they would persist for as long as he was faced with this choice, perhaps it didn’t matter any longer, perhaps it did, it wasn’t just about him, but the soul of his chariot, pulled now by a force it could call its own, but The Doctor could tell it would be pained by each step it took onto a new world, perhaps it would malfunction more, perhaps it would be disloyal through more fault of its own.
Or perhaps it would try to do better.
For The Doctor’s sake, he would have to take its word for it
But who’s word?
The word of Idris?
Or the word of Sutekh?
writing_prompt: The Doctor stands alone in the TARDIS, torn between trust and doubt—has his ship been guiding him to where he’s needed, or has it been manipulated by a darker force all along?

title: The Simpler Things Are Over
warnings: Choose Not To Use Archive Warnings, No Archive Warnings Apply
post_title: We all know Logan can't heal that fast...
comment:
Jean folded her clothes and packed them neatly into her bag, with a tight pull of the zip, she sealed it shut.
There.
All neat, secure, done.
The simpler things are over
she thought.
She lifted the bag off of the broken bed and walked out of the room, heading towards the hall. She was surprised to find Logan standing in the way of the door leading outside.
"What is it you want Logan?" Jean said.
"You don't have to go Jean" Logan replied.
"Didn't Hank's tests make it clear as crystal what I am?" Jean asked.
"Nothing's been more clearer to me, regardless of where you came from, you still belong"
"I'm a danger. To you, and all the others. You saw what Sinister did to me" Jean replied.
Logan walked over to her, stroking her lush red hair.
"...And we saw what you did when you came out of your funk. He may have cloned your body, but he couldn't corrupt your soul. Beneath the surface, yours still beats the heart of an X-Man"
Jean could sense his intentions, she knew now was not the place, and a part of her was pained to consider that it may never be the time,.
"It's...not just that, it's...Scott" she said, which caused Logan to recoil with hurt and shock
"Ain't it always?" he whispered.
"When he was faced with...with what he had to surrender, what he had to sacrifice, letting our baby go...he couldn't live with it, he turned, he ran. That's why I'm going Logan, how can I rebuild that trust, how can I hope to build another future, with a man who couldn't escape the shadows cast by his past?"
“If you ask me, ol’ ruby eyes couldn’t forgive you for siding with Bishop, for  being so willing to send little Nate off into yonder, so he took off himself”
Logan’s words cut deep.
“Don’t say that, don’t ever say that about him”
“And what about you? Is everything you’re doing now gonna be because of how needy he is?” Logan inquired
"This is something for me Logan, I wanted to leave the team, Scott was always so...hesitant, I could feel it, like I was tearing him away...this is where he belongs, I realize that now, and he deserves to be with someone who shares that need to belong somewhere"
"You think this other Jean has it in her? After all this, it won't be easy for her" Logan argued.
"That's why you need to take care of her Logan, take care of both of them. They 're lost, damaged..."
"So am I, but we're all big boys, we'll get better" Logan bragged
Jean stroked his rugged, stony face gently.
"Oh Logan, we all know you can't heal that fast"
"...Jean..."
"No, not Jean, not anymore, call me...Madelyn. Madelyn Pryor"
"Why that name?" Logan asked.
"...Because 'Prior' to the future, there was the past, and it's one I'm proud to have had, I'll cherish it always, my time with you, the X-Men, Scott, with Nathan. But nothing moves forward without leaving something behind. This is my right of way Logan, and right now, you're in the way"
Logan sighed and stood aside, allowing Madelyn to open the door and step outside into the starlit sky.
"Will we see you again?" Logan asked.
"If you seek out a storm, you're bound to get a forecast" Madelyn replied, and winked at him before heading towards the gates.
"She going to try and find Ororo?" asked Jubilee as Logan closed the front door.
"Sisters seem real happy doing this for themselves" Logan remarked
writing_prompt: After discovering the truth about her origins, Jean Grey decides to leave the X-Men and forge a new identity as Madelyn Pryor, but the path to independence is never simple when the past refuses to let go.

title: Yay, It's Christmas!
warnings: Choose Not To Use Archive Warnings, No Archive Warnings Apply
post_title: May prepares for a home intrusion, Peter intercepts her
comment:
“She’s up” said MJ, her eyes snapping open as a small patter of feet and a creaking door could be heard from outside her and Peter’s bedroom.
“On it” Peter replied, swiftly springing up from the bed he shared with his wife and making his way to their own door, turning the knob, and catching his darling daughter just as she attempted to
“Intercepted” said Peter, feeling quite smug about catching his daughter.
“That’s such a nerd dad way to say ‘busted’” MJ responded.
“Go back to sleep dear, I can handle it” Peter replied.
Peter noticed May had something in her hand.
“Hand it over” he said.
May revealed what she was holding.
“A bowl?”
“It’s for the milk. I thought the Cat might be thirsty”
“What cat?”
“The cat that comes at night to all the houses, that’s what they say on the news” May explained.
Peter realized what she was talking about, the mysterious burglar that had made their mark on the city’s more privileged corners of society, breaking into high rise buildings and making off with their most precious, their most priceless.
“Oh. That cat” Peter replied.
“You gonna tell it to Scat?” May asked.
“And upset you? Never...but you have to know, they say that cat steals things”
“But you’re a hero; you can get it all back”
“Maybe” Peter said.
“Always” May corrected him.
“You sound excited. I think you might want to take a glass of milk yourself, to calm you down” Peter responded.
“OK” said MAY.
“Leave that bowl with me, I’ll fill it up, leave some cookies too”
“But it’s not Christmas, only Santa gets cookies”
“For someone like the cat, it’s Christmas every day, she comes in and she helps herself to a present” Peter joked.
“Should we leave her a toy then?” asked May.
“Sure, what do you have in mind?”
“Well, I took one of Richard’s toys out of its box the other night; he won’t mind if anything happens to it, he told me toys don’t have value anymore if you take it out of the box”
“Your brother’s weird” Peter replied, May laughed.
Peter headed down the hall to the kitchen, May running past him with the bowl in hand.
“What did I tell you lady? Leave the cat to me, head over to bed”
“I want to see you fight her” said May.
“Is that all you want to see?”
“Oh yeah, and I don’t want to see you cheat on mom”
“And why would I do something like that?” Peter said, almost offended.
“The cat is very, very pretty”
“For all I know, she could be married herself”
“Who’d marry her?”
“I don’t know...Cat Stevens?”
“You’re funny dad”
“This ain’t no laughing matter young lady, you should know better”
“I’m sorry” May said, sensing she’d let her imagination run too wild with her, she sniffled.
Peter, thinking fast, took a carton of Milk out of the refrigerator, knelt down, and handed his daughter it. May smiled.
“Dad?”
“Yeah cupcake?”
“I was just kidding; I know you’d never cheat”
“Here, you pour it out, and you can leave out the cookies, but straight to bed afterwards OK?”
“Yay, it’s Christmas” said May.
Peter stood up and saw Mary Jane, in a night robe, standing in the hallway, her arms folded, and a warm, beaming smile on her face. She stretched her arms out wide and invited Peter in for a cuddle.
“Christmas every darn day” said Peter as he walked into his wife’s arms. May enjoy the sight of it so much, she didn’t realize she’d overflowed the bowl with the carton’s milky contents.
writing_prompt: Your child insists on leaving out milk and cookies—not for Santa, but for the mysterious "cat" burglar everyone’s talking about. Tonight, you decide to see if the legend is true.

title: Heading Towards Tomorrow
post_title:
1695 miles left...and Hailey, Scott and Beta take a break before their next tour to reflect on their nightmarish chance encounter with clowns.
Alternative ending to the last Disney "Road Trip" short
comment:
1695 miles left.
Hailey looked at Scott and Beta anxiously, their eyes had shifted away from her and towards one another, and they shook their heads in solemn solidarity.
"What is it guys?" she asked
"Hailey, you're an impossible girl" Beta replied.
"I'll say" Scott said.
"Here we just got rid of that clown horn and here you want to head on over to the Victorian Doll Museum like nothing all that peculiar just happened" Beta continued, keeping his eye firmly on the road.
"They're not gonna come to life if that's what you're worried about" Hailey
"How can you be sure? There was nothing on the list about prepping for homeless clown stalkers, why would your future self put you through that?" Scott asked.
"Gee I don't know Scott, maybe because of what came out of it" Hailey protested.
"And what would that be?" Scott asked.
Hailey tensed up, she twiddled her fingers.
"When the clowns confronted us, we...huddled around one another, I...felt something"
"Yeah, my elbows rubbing against yours "Scott responded.
"No Scott, I meant...I thought something really bad was gonna happen...to you, to both of us, like I'd make it to the future but...alone, or with Beta, which I don't know what's worse..."
"Thank you" said Beta sarcastically.
"No, no, don't take offence Beta, it's just you're a machine, and I'm flesh and blood, and it's no substitute for human companionship, that's beside the point, I thought I wouldn't be able to protect you Scott, I dragged you out on this crazy trip, on a lot of crazy trips, and you've never complained, never raised a voice against it, you put up with me, and this was an instance where I thought you'd go to the other side with that same attitude, and I'd feel so guilty over it"
"Yeah, but you have Sanjay waiting for you back home, he'd have helped you cope" said Scott.
"Forget Sanjay OK? He's not the face I want to wake up to every day, he never does the things you do, he never hangs out with us, he's always stuck at his stupid rich house serenading me with gifts and declaring his love, and It's only been a month since the dance. Why else do you think I arranged this trip and continuous museum stops? It was to get away from him for a while until I sorted my head out...and then throughout the trip I nearly lost both of ours. From drowning to clowns, all the terrors on the road, and the whole time I just wanted to wake up to one face. ONE face Scott!"
Scott didn't need to hear anything else; he put the tip of his finger to Hailey's lips and sealed it shut.
"Keep those eyes open Hailes, I want you to see this face coming, like a comet, ready to make impact" he said, taking off her glasses to stare into her daring and delicate eyes.
Hailey felt her body quiver, she placed her hands on Scott's lap, he removed his fingertip, and leaned in closer, and closer.
Contact was made, and the impact was seismic.
The kiss was deep, the kiss was true, the kiss made all the pain a relief.
The kiss meant the world, and they both knew it would change the world.
"Finally! Right, well, now that we've finally got that list item crossed off; let's get this show on the road shall we?" Beta said.
"We heading to the museum? Or will we head there tomorrow?" asked Scott.
"Scott, we've always been heading towards tomorrow" said Hailey, as she threw herself into Scott's arms to make out some more.
writing_prompt: On a road trip filled with bizarre dangers, a girl, her best friend, and a sarcastic robot navigate peril, emotions, and a mysterious list from the future that seems determined to change their lives forever.

title: I'm A Devil In Scarlet and Black
warnings: Choose Not To Use Archive Warnings, No Archive Warnings Apply
post_title: Spoilers for "Rogue", a scan of The Doctor's faces reveals a new, yet hauntingly familiar, surprise for The Doctor...and a forbidden truth dawns on him
comment:
The Doctor’s head was spinning around. Were he able to break free of the molecular bondage, it would best deemed fit to move out of his way, he just couldn’t get the song out of his head.
Nevertheless, Rogue would persist with the full body scan, and what he unearthed proved most interesting.
Not just to him, but to The Doctor himself.
As the scans unveiled their results, The Doctor found the faces were the same as they’d always been, wise, ancient, forever.
He knew he could revisit any of them, if destiny deemed it fit and proper, if a story hadn’t as yet ended.
But The Doctor noticed something else amongst them, something that greatly unsettled him, and seemed to intrigue Rogue also.
There was a new face.
And a distant, dormant memory awoke within him.
Memories of a time spent on Trenzalore, the prelude to a wider war to come, a battle to preserve his presence in the universe as a predatory being cut through the strands of his carefully woven web in creation. A mind of evil.
A great intelligence.
“You going to stay and stare, or are you going to release me from the molecular bondage?” The Doctor asked.
Rogue stood there slack jawed, for a spell, then gathered himself and did as he was requested.
“Sorry, your story checks out...all your stories, it’s funny, and you...suddenly act like it’s all so new to you”
“It’s still all new to me love and I don’t want to contemplate what could be in store next for me if one of those faces on the scan proves true...”
“Why? What’s the significance of it?” Rogue asked.
“There is an intelligence on this planet that is trying to kill me across all of time and space, I couldn’t stop it, but a friend of mine did, her name was Clara Oswald, and there is a good possibility an echo of her exists here, in this century, on these very grounds, on the patch of green we walked across on route to your ship, she is out there, fighting for every breath you make and every step you, and I, take”
“And seeing one of your faces convinces you of all that?”
“Isn’t it obvious Rogue? I wear that face, it isn’t just appearing there to mark what will become of me, it is what I become. I become that intelligence, a being of sheer indomitable will, the ability to control and kill whenever and however I please. My people, lords one and all, spoke once of ascending beyond all demand for physical presence in the universe, they wished to bring about the end of linear time and become free of cause and effect. What if I achieve it? My god Rogue...what if that is my calling? It was said I would have many names before the end...beast, storm, Valeyard...and now...Intelligence”
Rogue walked up to The Doctor and gently placed his hand on his.
“You have an illness; your friend sounds like a good reliever of it”
“Some illnesses you can’t cure” The Doctor admitted.
“It’s impossible to tow the line between present and future without a little bit of knowledge, but if you know yourself, then you know how to shape that future into something better to come"
““I’m a devil in scarlet and black, what would I know?” The Doctor asked.
Rogue smiled and played another bopping track across the com speakers.
‘’Say you won't leave me no more
I'll take you back again
No more excuses, no, no
'Cause I've heard them all before
A hundred times or more
I'll forgive and forget
If you say you'll never go
'Cause it's true what they say
It's better the devil you know (better the devil)
(Whoa-oh-oh-oh-oh-oh-oh-oh)’’
And just like that, The Doctor’s spirits suddenly rose.
writing_prompt: The Doctor discovers a new face among his future selves, one tied to a dark and impossible destiny—what if he becomes the very enemy he's spent lifetimes fighting?

title: Of The People, For The People
warnings: Choose Not To Use Archive Warnings, No Archive Warnings Apply
post_title: As Cody celebrated with his friends, several plans of retribution formed in Dwayne's mind. (post-Wrestlemania 40 night two), one potential account of what could be happening to Roman, Cody, and the Bloodline Monday night.
comment:
As Dwayne looked helplessly on as the superstars all filed out from the curtain and towards the centre of the ring to acknowledge the coronation of their hard  times hero Cody Rhodes as champion, an all too familiar and heinous feeling overtook him.
He hadn’t felt it since the days when Black Adam was struggling in theatres. Right around the time he had, with confidence, claimed that the hierarchy of power was due to change in the DC Cinematic universe.
Plans, of course, have a tendency to pivot and change just when the world is due a vision.
Something changes in the weather, the mood, the taste, is decided for the consumer, he had to believe that, it couldn’t be because the people decided against it. It couldn’t be because the people lacked taste, lacked common sense, and lacked any kind of vision.
He was a man of the people, the people’s champion, ordained by those who lived through life with an attitude.
What Dwayne felt was unwavering entropy enveloping all his sound and fury, signifying nothing.
Dwayne believed truly everything he did, moments, matches, mattered to the people. He refused to consider the idea the fans had decided what he was willing to share with them was of little substance, and of lesser significance.
His bloodline was being denied, his family was being denied. By the
people
.
This man, Cody Rhodes, was their champion.
Dwayne had been bestowed the title of peoples champion by the house of Ali, solidified in a belt that he carried around his shoulders and around his waist.
He was in touch with the common man, the fan, the mood of the public. He had to be, it was why this new era of professional wrestling had taken off, he had sensed the change in the weather, and had pivoted.
But he done so only because he thought the night would be an easy win, for there was no challenge here, no herculean task. He had defeated Cody and company rather comfortably on night one, with minimal effort on his part.
But, perhaps that was the problem, whatever issue, it lay in the roots of his bloodline, his family.
Roman had done what he could for him one night, but had failed him completely on another.
From Gorilla position he had watched Roman put more effort into braggadocios behaviour, mocking Cody, putting aside weapons when the rules commanded their use, and delaying his responses far too much when pushed to seal the fate of his enemies.
As Cody celebrated with his friends, several plans of retribution formed in Dwayne's mind.
He would think back to the days when Cody’s father Dusty was revered as more chaser than champion, and the reasons for why this was so.
He thought to more recent times, of how Daniel Bryan was challenged by the Authority. Overturning of decisions, title vacancies, indecisive refereeing, in-match turmoil. There could be so many games to play with the Rhodes to come.
But the glory would not go back to Roman. No, he needed to be made an example of. His own inability to set aside the spark that lit his fuse in Seth Rollins had extinguished the greatest title run of the early half of the 21st century, a return to gold would not undo such a blemish
The hierarchy of power had to change, there must be a new seat at the table.
A phone call would be made, meetings would be arranged, and Jacob Fatu would soon join him.
And soon new blood would be called upon to run through the line.
Faster, stronger, bigger, better.
They would challenge the new normal, they would rise, they would conquer.
And it would be all for the sake of the fans, for Dwayne knew them best.
He was of the people, by the people, and forever for the people.
writing_prompt: After losing his claim as the people's champion to a new hero, Dwayne begins to question his legacy and devises a plan to reclaim his throne, no matter the cost—because surely, no one knows the people better than him.

title: The Simplest Way To Travel
warnings: Choose Not To Use Archive Warnings, No Archive Warnings Apply
post_title: Peter works out the reasons why his recent dreams were reruns of the recent past
comment:
In Peter Parker’s dreams, his life reran.
Not every detail or memory, but the past several months felt inescapable.
From his wife’s theatre shutting down, to her being cast in a movie, to being hounded by The Hobgoblin, heading out to Hollywood on an out of this world road trip, they had done it all and then some.
It felt most unfair they had spent the second half of the year separated through a series of bizarre circumstances, from Peter wanting to be there for his Aunt as she tried to marry a subterranean monarch, to returning to New York and netting one of his first front page by-lines.
As his mind cycled through the memories again and at least once more, Peter came to realize the significance of them. These had been days of very real accomplishment, for both him and his wife.
And today both had earned their reward.
Peter’s eyes slid open; the reruns were at an end.
And the first face he saw was Mary Janes’, her lush bright eyes staring into his, blinking in synch, she gently graced his forehead with a gentle kiss.
“You sure can sleep Tiger. I was afraid they’d soon be ready to take off again with us still on board”
“Are we here Tigress?” Peter asked.
“Take a look and see” Mary Jane replied, inviting Peter to stare out of the plane windows.
Peter did so, and his smile only grew bigger.
Here they were, in the land down under, the plane had touched down in Sydney, Australia.
“I’m curious Tiger; just what was it you were dreaming about?” MJ asked.
“Just the Adventures we’ve had, before the adventures to come” Peter replied.
MJ grabbed his hand and hoisted him up, arm in arm; they disembarked from the plane into the white-hot heat of the outback.
Peter stared lovingly at MJ, and as he remembered just whose earnings had punched the ticket for this occasion, that sense of accomplishment was elevated by another wholesome sensation that gripped him.
Pride.
He was so proud of what MJ's work ethic had brought to their world, it rivalled the pride she herself felt being married to a streetwise superhero.
Both were one another’s heroes, both had achieved their dreams.
None of those dreams had ever been that small, but they had taught themselves that they could be pursued and achieved.
This had not been their first dream, their first vacation, but it still felt altogether different compared to all that had come before them. This felt like the beginning of an unwritten chapter.
This felt like the future.
“MJ...do you think, we should stay here?” Peter asked as he and MJ’s feet touched the smooth hard slabs of the airport tarmac, solidifying their arrival.
“Here? For real? Not just for a few days?”
“I fancy labelling myself the ‘Outback Arachnid’, does it sound good to you?”
“You could make a fortune coming up with Marvella movie titles Tiger”
“We’re gonna have to gauge just how popular your alter-ego is around these parts”
An enthusiastic girl, an influence on social media, suddenly ran up to both of them, asking for an autograph.
“Oh my gosh, you’re Mary Jane Parker and her husband, we’ve been following all your BTS on Marvella 2, can you believe the Horner’s want to write that film off for tax? You can’t let them do that to us, you’re huge over here”
MJ obliged the girl and gave her a signed autograph.
“And before you ask, I’ll be sure to like and subscribe” MJ joked.
Peter and MJ looked at one another, raising their eyebrows and smirking.
“I think we’ll be just fine Petey”
“Then it’s settled. You and me? Here for keeps?”
“One day at a time Tiger” MJ cautioned, not wanting Peter’s enthusiasm to run too far away with him.
Peter shrugged, and hoisted her high in the air, twirling.
“Lady, our daily routine is the simplest way to travel"
writing_prompt: After years of battling villains and chasing dreams, Peter Parker and Mary Jane land in Australia for a well-earned vacation. But as they consider making the land down under their new home, they can’t help but wonder—can Spider-Man truly hang up his web in a place this far from home?

title: Endless Winter, Eternal Spring
warnings: Choose Not To Use Archive Warnings, No Archive Warnings Apply
post_title: What if 15 didn't come alone to the club in "Church On Ruby Road?"
comment:
The night unveils and they are there, all sweat, no fear, in flight, each alight.
They are alive.
All of them.
The Noble family and their Doctor, of which two were present.
One was here on business, another for pleasure, at his best friend’s insistence.
“It’s a bit loud ain’t it?” said Donna as she raised her glass of gin and tonic to her lips.
“If you’re too loud, you’re too old Mum” said Rose as she got up from her seat at the family table to take to the floor, to mingle and bedazzle, to sparkle and glide.
“What does that say about him down there?” Donna asked of her Doctor as they looked down from the balcony to see the fifteenth in the line of succession twirling with excess in his proud highland kilt, his spins attracting the eagled eyes of a few choice spectators. The DJ had noticed this spark on fire, and had turned up the volume.
The Fourteenth turned back to Donna, a big smile on his face.
“Only as old as you feel” he said.
“And how do you feel space man?” Donna asked.
“He’s thirsty, I’m hungry” replied The Doctor, kneeling back and folding his arms behind his head to lean on them.
“Oh no, you’re gonna work up an appetite first, I want you on that floor pronto”
“But all I know to do is some inflatable giraffe” The Doctor insisted.
“Maybe this is the day you learn...by watching him doing that?” Donna said, pointing to the Fifteenth and his radiant raving.
“Fair point and you’re coming along too, just to keep an eye on our daughter”
“My daughter, that’s what you meant” said Shaun, downing another drink, his fifth, in rapid succession.
“Shaun, don’t be a scrooge, he didn’t mean it like that, he’s a part of us now, you know it”
“I know a lot more than you’re willing to admit to” said Shaun.
“You’re drunk”
“Why don’t I call a cab then?” Shaun said, slapping the table with his right hand several times as he tried to force some kind of hysteria from himself.
“I’ll help him outside sweetheart, you go have fun” Wilf said, winking at The Doctor as he helped a stumbling Shaun to his feet.
“Oh, oh Wilf, no, don’t try setting us up like this, I don’t want any....” The Doctor began, but Wilf wasn’t having it.
“He’s almost at the acceptance stage son, don’t be this far along in denial, now you take that jewel over there and you treat her right on that floor, you hear me?”
The Doctor nodded, Wilf saluted The Doctor and headed with Shaun towards the exit.
The Doctor extended his hand to Donna, initially hesitant, Donna placed her hand in his and squeezed it tightly.
They led each other down the stairs and onto the floor.
The music continued to raise the temperature, everyone began wildly thrusting, trying to look bigger, reach higher.
They felt together, they felt connected, they felt release, and they felt loved.
At first timid in their approach, The Doctor-Donna soon blazed their trail across the floor as eyes connected and memories stirred. It was as if a wild fire had broken out, and no sprinkler could dose their flames.
The Fifteenth laughed and headed upstairs to the balcony, where he stopped a young blonde girl from dropping her glass.
Fortune may have favoured the girl he would come to know as Ruby Sunday tonight, but the fleeting curtain of night was still young, and for now Christmas truly belonged to him and Donna Noble.
“How’s old age feeling now Spaceman?” said Donna as she gave The Doctor a maddening twirl.
“I’m like the Earth as it turns, from endless winter to eternal spring”
“Let’s see by May if you dance any better” said Donna cheekily, and gave him a kiss on the nose before daring him to come find her amidst the teeming mass of flirtatious flesh that was the packed nightclub crowd
writing_prompt: At a packed nightclub on Christmas Eve, The Doctor and Donna Noble find themselves swept into the chaos of music, laughter, and wild dancing. But amidst the revelry, old memories stir, new connections spark, and the night promises more than just celebration.

title: Even More Of Me
warnings: Choose Not To Use Archive Warnings, No Archive Warnings Apply
post_title: The Bi-Generation has taken The Doctor into strange new territory and he shares some of his thoughts with Donna in the comfort of her bedroom
comment:
He didn’t want to wake her.
He gazed at her luscious prone body, her head buried beneath two pillows.
He heard a shot ring out, Wilf out in the garden, trying to get one better on the moles.
As she snored, The Doctor smiled.
She could power her way through anything, nothing could disrupt her, not even the sounds of clapping thunder.
He caressed her locks of long red hair; it was this particular gesture that stirred her into consciousness.
She rose upwards, initially clinging the sheets to her chest. Then, when it became apparent who was in the room with her, she threw them down, revealing that she wasn’t wearing anything.
“Hey” she said, switching on the night lamp to get a good look at her best friend. The love of all his lives.
“Hi” The Doctor said, taking a seat at the edge of the bed and wearily rubbing his eyes.
“You having the same as the night before?” she asked, giving his back a good rub to ease how tense he was.
“Every time. It’s all of them Donna, all of me...detaching, dying, regenerating, then, waking up elsewhere, reborn, renewed. Their lives came to an end, and by some miracle, began again, a TARDIS waiting for them where last they stood...and then they’re off...out into the unknown...”
“...And you?” Donna asked, “How does it make you feel?”
The Doctor looked into her eyes and matched it with a hearty gleam.
“I thought I’d feel alone, I thought, ‘well there’s’ not much left of me is there? All the others have shut the door behind me, I’m not dead I suppose, but who am I without all those other missing pieces? All those other incarnations? That’s what I thought I’d feel like, but look where I am, you and me, the TARDIS...”
“...Our Rose” said Donna.
“She’s not mine” The Doctor argued, not wanting such a modest compliment, he didn’t think it fair on Donna’s now ex-husband, the man she ditched once it became clear who was truly in her heart.
“Oh but she is” Donna insisted, “The meta crisis passed down from you, to me, to her, you helped make her who she was spaceman, oh Shaun he did his part, but it’s because of you that she was able to save the world. She’s more than man, woman, or child, she’s our experiences, all of time and space, all of you and me. Our daughter. Our blood, our life”
Her words soothed the man before her, a man who, day to day, was still adjusting to a regular run around the days before and the days ahead, who’s recent bi-regeneration had done more than enable new life to gallop away, but for all those long dead stars that glittered along his time stream to reignite and shoot like comets across the stratosphere.
All of time, all of space, all of them.
And he was the piece left on Earth, with the family he always wanted, with the love he’d always craved.
He wrapped his arms over Donna’s barren waist, and held on tightly as he hoisted her up.
“How do you do it Donna Noble? How do you give me so much to live for?”
“Simplest answer spaceman, by living, now kiss me”
The Doctor pressed his lips to hers, and both folded themselves far beneath the sheets, eager to demonstrate how alive they truly were.
Donna was so lucky to have this face back, this form, yet it did cause her to drift a little in their lovemaking, driving her to a momentary distraction.
“Just occurred to me...if the bi-regeneration gave new life to all your previous selves, and this body is a retread, a copy...that means there exists in the time stream....” Donna began; The Doctor pressed his finger to her lips
“Yeah, even more of me” he replied, pointing to his face.
As she relaxed and let him inside of her, Donna knew she would dream of nothing else afterwards.
writing_prompt: After a miraculous bi-regeneration, The Doctor finds himself grounded on Earth, living a quiet life with Donna Noble and their extraordinary daughter, Rose—but as echoes of his past selves ripple through the time stream, he begins to wonder if he can truly leave his old lives behind.
